summary: My first skin for Skyrim designed for the CBBE body, comes in 4 flavors, Shaved, Strip, Brasil and Unshaven.
descriptionHtml:
This is my first texture set for Skyrim.  It\'s for CBBE bodies and is a combination of my original work using some high resolution textures for skin pores, nipples and er.. other parts as well as using other textures to work from as a starting point.  

For this release I\'ve gone for the toned clean look, but I do have thoughts to make a flat stomach version, and then dirtied up skins rather than the \"show room\" model look later.

I\'ve done my best to try and ensure that the skin is seamless and it\'s pretty darn close, I don\'t use ENB so I haven\'t got those dreamy awesome images to show, but I think the images I made give an idea of how it looks, but of course it looks much better in game I think :)

File sizes:
body files are 2048x2048
hands are 1024x1024

Use NMM to install,or manually place all files in Data/textures/actor/character/female 

NO HEAD TEXTURES INCLUDED, so your face wont be changed by installing this.

Big shout out go to::

Apachii for the amazing hair styles
Caliente for CBBE, love it
SvarogNL for his great work on abs and body muscle styles
XS2REALITY amazing skin work
Navetsea for more amazing skin textures

Notes:
Since my skin doesn\'t contain a head texture, it can happen that there will be a visible join line between the body and neck (neck seam), I advise installing Calientes CBBE from here http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666 and running the enclosed Texture Blender to remove any neck seam.

Updates:

**Version 1.2 installer fixed to correct file structure. 07/04/13

Version 1.2
Overhaul of body normal map and texture, both improved over the whole body as well as pubic region, normal map for hands improved to give more detailed looking fingers.

Version 1.1
Sorry for the rapid update to 1.1, but it did fix something that really didn\'t look right with the texture.

**************************************
I\'d just like to add (after missing a credit above)  that the work of other texture artists is not just very good, but I found it essential, without these great texture artists I would not have known where to start, and I\'m sure the same could be said by many others trying to learn texturing in Skyrim and you all have my appreciation for the work you have done.
author: Naturlich68
